citation.article-title: Vibrio calviensis sp. nov., a halophilic, facultatively oligotrophic 0.2 microm-fiIterabIe marine bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Vibrio calviensis sp. nov.
Vibrio calviensis (cal.vi.en'sis. N.L. gen. n. calviensis of or pertaining to the Bay of Calvi, Corsica, from where the type strain was isolated)
The description is based on data compiled from Vybiral et al. (1999) and data generated in this study.
The cells are straight to slightly curved and rod-shaped (0.25-1.0x0.75-2.5 μm), Gram-negative and motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on Bacto marine agar 2216 (Difco) as well as on sea-water agar are brownish, translucent, circular, smooth and convex with an entire edge.
Bioluminescence was not observed.
Growth occurs at room temperature, at 30 °C and within 10 d at 4 °C.
No growth occurs at 37 °C.
Grows on TCBS agar, producing green colonies.
Sodium ions are essential for growth.
Growth occurs between 1.5 and 12% NaCl.
The optimal NaCl concentration for growth is 2.5-3.5% (w/v) ; there is no growth at 1.0% NaCl or when NaCl is absent.
Susceptible to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, colistin sulphate, fusidic acid, kanamycin, penicillin G, polymyxin B, streptomycin, tetracycline and vibriostatic agent O/129.
Resistant to lincomycin, oxacillin and spectinomycin.
Oxidase and catalase tests give positive results.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Acid but no gas is produced from glucose.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but not further to N2.
The Voges-Proskauer reaction is negative and the methyl red test is positive.
Gelatin and Tween 80 are hydrolysed but casein, starch and agar are not.

The following substrates are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: β-gentiobiose, cellobiose, citrate, ribose, galactose, gluconate, mannitol, melibiose, maltose, D-mannose, D-turanose and saccharose.

The following substrates are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: adipate, amidon, arbutine, L-arabinose, caprate, D-fructose, D-glucose, glycogen, inulin, methyl α-D-mannoside, N-acetylglucosamine, trehalose, D- and L-xylose.
Alkaline phosphatase, acidic phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase (C14), β-galactosidase, lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and urease are produced.
Arginine dihydrolase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, amannosidase, trypsin and valine arylamidase are not produced.
The major cellular fatty acids are 16:1 cis, 16:0 and 18:1trans9, cis11; in addition, hydroxylated fatty acids 12:0 3-OH and 14:0 3-OH are present in minor amounts.
The cellular polyamine content is characterized by the presence of putrescine, spermidine, cadaverine, 1,3-diaminopropane and symnorspermidine.
The G+C content of the DNA is 49.5 mol%.
The type strain is RE35F/12T (=CIP 107077T=DSM 14347T); it was isolated from sea water by 0.2 μm membrane filtration.
